str2: Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To account or treat as worthy. From axios; to deem entitled or fit.
Double, two-fold. From dis and the base of pleion; two-fold.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
Most of all, especially. Neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb mala; most or particularly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
